items.title: Microsoft fires employee protestor who called AI boss a ‚Äòwar profiteer‚Äô
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft fired employee Ibtihal Aboussad for misconduct during the company's 50th anniversary event.
- Aboussad and another protestor interrupted CEO Mustafa Suleyman, accusing him of being a "war profiteer."
- Both protestors called for Microsoft to cease contracts with the Israeli government, associating with the group No Azure for Apartheid.
- Aboussad was escorted out of the event, and Agrawal resigned but was dismissed shortly after.
- An internal email cited the disruptive nature of their actions and lack of remorse as reasons for the terminations.

items.title: Whoopsie daisy Bitcoin!
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.explanation: A gun is the ultimate surprise party crasher for an assassin‚Äîhard to dodge that!

items.title: Google TV remotes are getting a ‚ÄòFree TV‚Äô button
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Google TV devices will now include a ‚ÄòFree TV‚Äô or ‚ÄòLive TV‚Äô button on remotes, confirmed by a company spokesperson.
- The button will provide quick access to free, ad-supported TV channels via Google TV FreePlay.
- Google states this change aims to enhance user experience, responding positively to feedback since launching free live TV options.
- Details on the button's size, color, and requirement scope (regional or worldwide) have not been disclosed.

items.title: Here are the best streaming service deals available right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- 2025 offers great streaming options but subscription costs can add up.
- Current deals include promotions for both new and returning subscribers across various services.
- Disney Plus offers a bundle with Hulu and ESPN for $10.99/month.
- Hulu provides an ad-supported plan at $9.99/month with access to shows like 'The Handmaid‚Äôs Tale'.
- Peacock offers next-day programming from NBC and live sports starting at $7.99/month for ad-supported content.

items.title: Major publishers call on the US government to ‚ÄòStop AI Theft‚Äô
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Hundreds of publishers, including The New York Times, The Washington Post, and The Guardian, are launching an ad campaign urging the U.S. government to protect content from AI.
- The campaign, named Support Responsible AI, includes phrases like ‚ÄúKeep Watch On AI‚Äù and ‚ÄúAI Steals From You Too.‚Äù
- The initiative aims to promote fair compensation for publishers by Big Tech companies using their content without authorization.

items.title: The best Nintendo Switch controllers to buy right now
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch Pro Controller is highly recommended for its quality, features, and compatibility with multiple platforms.
- The Hori Split Pad Pro is favored for handheld mode, offering better ergonomics and additional rear buttons but lacks features like motion control and rumble.
- GuliKit KingKong 3 Pro and Max controllers provide Xbox-style ergonomics with deep customization options and advanced technology to prevent drift.
- Third-party controllers may lack some Nintendo features like NFC and HD rumble, but select options are versatile and well-built.

items.title: The White House‚Äôs group chat screwup is even more ridiculous than we thought
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- National security adviser Mike Waltz accidentally added a journalist to a Signal chat due to a Siri suggestion.
- The mistake occurred while trying to update contact details for a Trump spokesperson.
- Internal investigation revealed miscommunication involving an email from Atlantic's Jeffrey Goldberg.
- The White House's choice of Signal for sensitive discussions raises concerns over security protocols.

items.title: The see-through Beats Studio Buds Plus are on sale for less than $100
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The **Beats Studio Buds Plus** are currently priced at **$99.95**, down from **$169.95**, matching their best price to date.
- The earbuds feature a **translucent color option** and provide sound quality that rivals the pricier **AirPods Pro**.
- They are water-resistant, come with four swappable silicone ear tips, and have **transparency mode** and **Active Noise Cancellation** (ANC).
- Unlike AirPods Pro, they support a variety of **iOS and Android** functionalities including **Find My** and **Fast Pair** but lack features like head-tracking spatial audio.

items.title: Nintendo‚Äôs Switch 2 upgrade packs for Zelda will cost $9.99
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Nintendo announces that the Switch 2 upgrades for the Legend of Zelda games will cost $9.99 for existing owners.
- The prices for the new Switch 2 Zelda games are $69.99 for Breath of the Wild and $79.99 for Tears of the Kingdom.
- Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour will also be priced at $9.99, despite debate over whether it should be included with the console.
- Pre-orders for the Switch 2 have started in other countries; U.S. pricing affected by tariffs remains uncertain.

items.title: GM's UK Design Team Unveils Futuristic Electric Corvette Concept
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- GM reveals a new electric Corvette concept designed by a UK team in Birmingham.
- The concept features a hypercar design with aviation-inspired elements, powered gullwing doors, and an augmented windshield display.
- The upper half of the design is based on the classic 1963 Corvette Sting Ray, described as 'Apex Vision'.
- EV battery technology is integrated into the vehicle's structure for improved efficiency.
- On tracks, the Corvette can deploy dorsal fins for aerodynamics and better cornering performance.
- A new GMC concept vehicle, designed for camping, is set to be revealed later this year.

items.title: Google's AI Mode can now see and search with images
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google introduces multimodal capabilities to its AI Mode chatbot, enhancing image recognition features.
- Users can now upload or snap a picture to receive detailed responses and links about the content.
- The update combines Gemini AI with Lens image recognition, accessible in the Google app on Android and iOS starting today.
- Offers nuanced responses by issuing multiple queries about objects in images, helping to identify subjects and suggest related content.
- AI Mode, which launched last month for Google One AI Premium subscribers, is now expanding to millions more users in the US.

items.title: The Last of Us season 2 is a brutal, bloody expansion of the game
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Season 2 covers roughly half of the plot of 
  [The Last of Us Part II](https://www.theverge.com/tv-reviews/644415/the-last-of-us-season-2-review-hbo) in seven episodes, shorter than the first season's nine episodes.
- The storyline centers on Ellie and Joel, focusing on themes of revenge and personal sacrifice after a pivotal decision by Joel.
- The season explores broader character developments and world-building, introducing new characters and deeper plot elements, enhancing the narrative's context.
- The season premiered on April 13th on HBO and Max, continuing the grim and violent themes of the source material.

items.title: Death Stranding movie nabs director of Pig and A Quiet Place: Day One
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Michael Sarnoski has been announced as the director and writer for the upcoming *Death Stranding* movie.
- Sarnoski previously directed *Pig* and *A Quiet Place: Day One*.
- The movie is based on Hideo Kojima‚Äôs 2019 video game, which follows Sam Porter Bridges, portrayed by Norman Reedus.
- *Death Stranding* features surreal elements, including supernatural monsters and a unique delivery concept.
- A sequel titled *Death Stranding 2: On the Beach* is set to launch on June 26th.

items.title: 22 years later, modders are keeping SimCity 4 alive
items.author: Tom Hawking
items.summary:
- SimCity 4 was released in 2003 and has a dedicated modding community that has developed extensive modifications over the years.
- Modders like Tarkus and Ulisse Wolf emphasize the game's unmatched simulation depth and the supportive community as key reasons for continuing to work on the game.
- The Network Addon Mod (NAM) is a significant project that enhances the game's transportation systems and continues to evolve with a dedicated team of global contributors.
- Modding has grown with improved access to the game's source code, allowing for advanced custom features and bug fixes.
- The vibrant community actively collaborates across forums and platforms like Discord, fostering a friendly environment for both veterans and newcomers.

items.title: One of the best 4K QD-OLED gaming monitors is cheaper than ever
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Alienware‚Äôs 27-inch 4K QD-OLED, the AW2725Q, launched a month ago at CES 2025.
- Now available at $749, down from the regular price of $899, a 17% discount.
- Features include a 240Hz refresh rate, VRR, and a high 166 pixels per inch display.
- Includes a 3-year warranty against burn-in and has an anti-reflective coating.
- Alienware also plans to release a 27-inch 1440p QD-OLED monitor for $549.99 this summer, but prices may vary due to tariffs.

items.title: Nintendo confirms Switch 2 Joy-Cons lack Hall effect joysticks
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Nintendo Joy-Cons redesigned for the Switch 2 but do not use Hall effect sensors for anti-drift.
- Senior VP Nate Bihldorff confirmed Joy-Con 2 not Hall Effect, indicating different feel.
- Switch 2 controllers are larger, more durable; details on the technology used remain undisclosed.

items.title: Mission: Impossible ‚Äì The Final Reckoning‚Äôs new trailer is one big leap of faith
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The new trailer for *Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning* is set to premiere this summer after multiple delays.
- The trailer indicates Ethan Hunt (Tom Cruise) faces a dangerous AI involved in high-stakes decisions impacting his allies.
- The film is scheduled to release on May 23rd, featuring high-octane stunts that have been a hallmark of the franchise.

items.title: UK bans fake reviews and ‚Äòsneaky‚Äô fees for online products
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- The UK has banned fake reviews and hidden fees to protect online shoppers.
- New measures under the Digital Markets, Competition, and Consumer Act 2024 require all mandatory fees to be included in advertised prices.
- The law targets ‚Äòdripped pricing‚Äô practices where additional fees are revealed at checkout, misleading customers.
- The regulations will affect food delivery and ticket booking services, ensuring all fees are transparent from the start.
- Businesses are forbidden from using fake reviews, with providers responsible for moderating reviews on their platforms.
- The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) can impose fines of up to 10% of a company's global turnover for non-compliance.

items.title: WhatsApp tests letting you block people from exporting your chats
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- WhatsApp is testing an 'advanced chat privacy' option to control exporting chats and media saving.
- The feature is currently in beta on iOS and spotted on Android.
- It prevents chat history exporting and media auto-saving to device galleries when enabled, but messages can still be forwarded or screenshotted.
- Group chat participants are notified when the setting is activated, which also disables Meta AI features.
- No official release date for wider rollout has been provided.

items.title: The rise of ‚ÄòFrankenstein‚Äô laptops in New Delhi‚Äôs repair markets
items.author: Hanan Zaffar
items.summary:
- Technicians in Delhi‚Äôs Nehru Place are crafting low-cost hybrid laptops from old, discarded parts, addressing high demand for affordable tech.
- Repairs are made from e-waste, providing functional laptops for students and gig workers at a fraction of new prices (e.g., INR 10,000 vs. INR 70,000).
- The market for ‚ÄòFrankenstein‚Äô laptops competes against tech giants who push for planned obsolescence, making repairs more complex and costly.
- There are ongoing discussions in India about right-to-repair laws to support this growing ecosystem, but progress remains slow.

items.title: UiPath‚Äôs Daniel Dines on why he needed to become CEO again
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Daniel Dines, co-founder of UiPath, has returned as CEO after Rob Enslin's resignation in May 2024.
- Dines stepped down to focus on being chief innovation officer before returning to the CEO role.
- UiPath specializes in robotic process automation (RPA), a field disrupted by emerging AI technologies.
- The company faced market challenges and execution issues leading up to Dines' return as CEO.
- Dines emphasized the importance of understanding his role within the company and the business decisions made during turbulent times.
- Discussions included the impact of AI on UiPath‚Äôs products and the need for strategic integration for future success.

items.title: Netflix is getting a Peppa Pig mobile game
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Netflix is releasing a Peppa Pig mobile game called *World of Peppa Pig* in June for subscribers in the US.
- The game will feature various activities like spot the difference, interactive mini-games, coloring books, dress-up games, and memory challenges.
- This game is part of Netflix's strategy to include more kids-focused games among its offerings, alongside multiplayer and narrative titles.

items.title: Nintendo says tariffs aren‚Äôt the reason the Switch 2 costs $449.99
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Nintendo's Switch 2 will retail for $449.99, up from the original Switch's price of $299.99.
- Nintendo's president Doug Bowser stated that tariffs did not influence the new console's pricing.
- The company announced a delay for Switch 2 preorders to assess potential tariff impacts and market conditions.
- The higher price reflects new features such as a larger LCD screen, more powerful internals, and redesigned Joy-Con controllers.
- Nintendo continues to sell the original Switch models alongside the new console without an immediate pricing change for them.
- Some games for the Switch 2 also have increased prices, such as Mario Kart World at $79.99.

items.title: Why Some Switch 2 Carts Won‚Äôt Have Games on Them
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Nintendo Switch 2 will utilize game-key cards that do not contain a game but provide a download key instead.
- This approach allows publishing partners to bring larger games to market without needing oversized cartridges.
- Nintendo aims to distinguish the Switch 2 from its predecessor in retail, creating separate sections for the new console.

items.title: DOGE plans now reportedly include an IRS ‚Äòhackathon‚Äô
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Elon Musk‚Äôs Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) is planning a hackathon to create a mega API for accessing IRS data.
- The aim is to transfer data to a cloud platform, possibly third-party, to serve as the agency's system read center.
- The project involves pulling together IRS engineers and potentially collaborating with Palantir for data collection.
- The planned timeline of 30 days for API completion is criticized by IRS employees as unrealistic.
- DOGE operatives leading the project include Gavin Kliger and health-tech CEO Sam Corcos.
- A March 14th letter from Senator Ron Wyden highlights the IRS's refusal to comply with DOGE‚Äôs data access requests.

items.title: The Best Smartwatches for Android in 2023
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The smartwatches market for Android has expanded significantly in recent years, providing consumers with various options.
- Wear OS 5 is currently supported by Samsung's Galaxy Watch series, Google Pixel Watch 3, and soon, OnePlus Watch 3.
- Key smartwatches highlighted include:
  - **Galaxy Watch 6 Classic**: Improved battery life, larger display, and priced around $230.
  - **Pixel Watch 3**: Enhanced fitness features and integrations at $350.
  - **TicWatch Pro 5**: Noted for its battery life and performance at $140.
  - **Amazfit Active 2**: Offers good value with health tracking for about $100.
- Considerations for choosing a smartwatch include compatibility with your smartphone brand, fitness tracking capabilities, battery life, and ease of use.

items.title: How to use your phone as a hotspot
items.author: David Nield
items.summary:
- Running a mobile hotspot allows internet access away from home or office, providing more security and potentially better speeds than public Wi-Fi.
- Setup instructions vary by device:
  - **Pixel**: Go to Settings > Network & Internet > Hotspot & tethering to enable and configure.
  - **Samsung Galaxy**: Navigate to Settings > Connections > Mobile Hotspot and Tethering to toggle and check details.
  - **iPhone**: Access Settings > Personal Hotspot to turn on sharing and adjust compatibility.
- Check your mobile plan for hotspot data limits, as most carriers handle this separately from regular data plans.

items.title: ‚ÄòMillions‚Äô may have protested Trump and Musk yesterday
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Hundreds of thousands signed up for over 1,300 "Hands Off!" protests against Trump and Musk.
- Activist group MoveOn estimates millions attended, with over 100,000 in Washington, DC alone.
- Protests addressed various issues, including Trump‚Äôs trade war and civil rights.
- Over 150 groups participated, including ACLU and labor unions.
- Some outlets estimate attendance in the hundreds of thousands, while organizers claimed over 3 million nationwide.

items.title: Wi-Fi is one of the great backward compatibility success stories
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The author's home network connects over 60 devices spanning five generations of Wi-Fi.
- Wi-Fi maintains backward compatibility, allowing newer devices to connect with older versions seamlessly.
- The Wi-Fi Alliance, formed in 1999, certifies products for interoperability to ensure compatibility across devices.
- Certification provides assurance that devices will work together, but some companies like Eero opt for internal certification.
- Issues with device connectivity often stem from untested or uncertified devices, not Wi-Fi version discrepancies.
- Support for the 2.4GHz band is crucial, as it is commonly used by older devices and smart home products.
- The ongoing support for backward compatibility is significant for maintaining device functionality over generations.

items.title: Quantum mechanics might have the solution to joystick drift
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch is significantly impacted by joystick drift, affecting various controllers across brands.
- Tunneling magnetoresistance (TMR) is a potential solution, offering advantages over traditional potentiometer-based controllers.
- TMR technology allows for better longevity as it avoids wear and tear found in current joystick designs.
- Unlike Hall effect sensors, TMR sensors have higher sensitivity and lower power consumption, leading to potential improvements in joystick performance.
- Third-party manufacturers are already producing controllers with TMR joysticks, aiming to address the drift issue. 
- Mainstream adoption of TMR technology in major gaming brands could take several years due to cost factors.

items.title: Your House is like a choose-your-own adventure mystery book
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Your House is a visual novel where players interact with the story as if reading a book.
- Players assume the role of Debbie, who explores a mansion filled with secrets and puzzles after receiving a mysterious postcard and key on her birthday.
- The game features a unique interaction style, with bold text indicating actions, and beautiful noir comic-style illustrations.
- Gameplay includes solving puzzles and uncovering secrets by interacting with the environment.
- It has a reading experience aspect, with a narrow aspect ratio mimicking a physical book.
- The game is relatively short, with a playtime of about three hours, and is available on PC, iOS, and Android.

items.title: ‚ÄòHands Off‚Äô: Protesters deliver a sweeping message to Trump and Musk at a DC rally
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Nationwide Hands Off protests attracted millions across 1,300 events, protesting against Trump and Musk.
- The DC rally saw over 100,000 participants, including various lawmakers and organizers.
- Protesters voiced a multitude of concerns, highlighting the need to protect democracy and essential government programs.
- The event remained peaceful with a focus on non-violence amid messages against policy changes under Trump and Musk.
- Organizers facilitated travel to DC protests, with equal turnout reported in cities like New York and even in red states.

items.title: One streaming app to (almost) rule them all
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Plex has launched a new mobile app that integrates streaming media with personal libraries and is subscription-based at $4.99/month.
- Delta 1.7 is now the best game emulator for iPhone and includes online multiplayer for Nintendo DS games.
- Skylight, resembling TikTok, runs on the AT Protocol and is gaining popularity.
- Microsoft celebrated its 50th anniversary by releasing its original Altair BASIC source code.
- The Nintendo Switch 2 is officially launching in June; more details on specs and game lineup have been released.
- Sofa app has introduced a podcast player and is noted for its ease of use in managing content.

items.title: Color is a mathematical nightmare
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Color is defined through complex mathematical models known as color spaces.
- Different color models (CMYK, RGB, HSL) serve various purposes, impacting color representation in applications like printing and digital displays.
- Gamut refers to the range of colors a device can display, influencing the suitability of monitors for creative tasks.
- Color spaces like sRGB, Adobe RGB, and Rec.709 are optimized for specific applications, ensuring color consistency Across devices.

items.title: Meta AI gets two new models as Meta releases Llama 4
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Meta has announced the release of [Llama 4](https://ai.meta.com/blog/llama-4-multimodal-intelligence/), a new collection of AI models for applications in WhatsApp, Messenger, and Instagram Direct.
- The two models released are Llama 4 Scout, a small model suitable for a single Nvidia H100 GPU, and Llama 4 Maverick, comparable to GPT-4o.
- Llama 4 Scout features a 10-million-token context window and outperforms several competitive models, including Google's Gemini 3.
- Llama 4 Behemoth, currently in training, claims 288 billion active parameters and aims to surpass models like GPT-4.5.
- Meta uses a ‚Äúmixture of experts‚Äù architecture to optimize resources based on task requirements.
- Future developments will be discussed at [LlamaCon on April 29th](https://www.llama.com/llama-downloads/).
- Despite being labeled as ‚Äúopen-source,‚Äù the licensing requirements have faced criticism for being restrictive, especially for large commercial users.

items.title: More than 1,200 rallies rally worldwide protest Trump and Musk
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Protests against President Trump and Elon Musk occurred globally, organized by over 150 groups, across more than 1,200 locations.
- Demonstrations included 'Tesla Takedown' protests targeting Tesla showrooms amid Musk's layoffs and declining sales.
- Large crowds gathered in major cities like Washington, DC, Chicago, and overseas in Berlin and London, with significant turnout even in smaller communities.

items.title: Microsoft has created an AI-generated version of Quake
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft unveiled its Muse AI model which can generate gameplay, now featuring an AI-generated version of **Quake II**.
- The tech demo is playable in a browser but limited in interactions and time.
- This latest demo runs at 640 x 360 resolution and retains a playable frame rate, compared to earlier versions that were significantly lower.
- The AI model is aimed at helping game developers prototype games and improve classic titles like **Quake II** for modern hardware.
- Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer emphasized the potential of making classic games portable to various platforms using AI models.
- More interactive AI game experiences through Copilot Labs are expected soon, along with enhancements to Copilot as a gameplay coach.

items.title: Tron: Ares blends the real world with the digital in its first trailer
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Disney released the first trailer for **Tron: Ares**, a sequel to **Tron: Legacy**.
- The trailer features visuals of a dark and moody world with signature light trails.
- Jared Leto's character, Ares, is shown fleeing from police on a light cycle.
- A massive airship hovers over a city, while Jeff Bridges reprises his role as Kevin Flynn.
- The film's soundtrack is done by **Nine Inch Nails** and is set to release in theaters on **October 10th**.

items.title: The 7 writing apps I used to start and finish my book
items.author: Kevin Nguyen
items.summary:
- The author, Kevin Nguyen, shares his experiences with different writing apps used throughout his book writing process.
- He uses **Bear** for structured ideas and **Notes** for quick thoughts, emphasizing the importance of having different environments for creative work.
- The primary drafting is done in **iA Writer**, which Nguyen appreciates for its simplicity despite its cost.
- **Google Docs** is utilized for organizing and revising, especially once a significant amount of text is produced.
- Nguyen discusses his choice to use **Scrivener** for its organizational features but prefers to write in Google Docs due to its familiarity.
- Final revisions involve exporting to **Microsoft Word** for editing and proofing before publication, illustrating the necessity of adapting tools for professional standards.

items.title: Jaguar Land Rover pauses US shipments over Trump tariffs
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) has announced a pause in shipments to the US for April 2025 due to new tariffs imposed by President Trump.
- The pause is a response to a 25% tariff on imported vehicles that could significantly increase car prices by $5,000 to $10,000.
- Approximately 25% of JLR‚Äôs annual sales, totaling 400,000 vehicles, are directed to US buyers, and the company believes it has enough existing stock to last for about two months before resuming shipments.
- Other companies, like Nintendo, are also affected by the tariffs, delaying preorders of the Switch 2.

items.title: The best wireless earbuds to buy right now
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- The market for wireless earbuds has significantly improved in sound quality and performance.
- Companies like Sony, Apple, and Samsung have released top-rated models with features such as noise cancellation and sound quality.
- Exclusive features (e.g., head-tracking spatial audio) are often tied to specific brands and devices.
- Featured earbuds include:
  - **Sony WF-1000XM5**: Best overall noise cancellation, dynamic sound, comfortable fit. Price: $248.
  - **Nothing Ear (a)**: Budget option with decent ANC and good sound. Price: $79.
  - **Bose QuietComfort Ultra**: Excellent sound and ANC, priced at $299.
  - **Apple AirPods Pro (2nd Gen)**: Improved features over the original with a price of $198.
- Selection criteria for earbuds include sound quality, noise cancellation, battery life, and comfort.

items.title: ‚ÄòViews‚Äô are lies
Trump‚Äôs tariffs killed his TikTok deal
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- TikTok's fate in the US was expected to be decided by April 5th, with multiple bids emerging from companies like Amazon and OnlyFans.
- President Trump's tariff war has hindered any potential deal for TikTok, with the White House only seriously considering an Oracle-led consortium.
- The tariff announcement disrupted the approval of a proposal to license TikTok's algorithm from China, affecting negotiations and leaving TikTok's future uncertain.

items.title: DOGE staffers are listed in the FCC directory
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Elon Musk‚Äôs Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has staff listed in the FCC directory.
- Identified staff include Tarak Makecha, Jordan Wick, and Jacob Altik, associated with the Office of the Chairman.
- Makecha previously worked for Tesla and is involved in a drone detection company; Wick is a former Waymo engineer; Altik is a lawyer.
- DOGE has recently expanded into other enforcement agencies, including the Federal Trade Commission.
- The FCC‚Äôs authority intersects with Musk's businesses, particularly SpaceX and Starlink operations.

items.title: Ring‚Äôs founder is back at Amazon
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Jamie Siminoff, founder of Ring, has returned to Amazon as vice president after a two-year absence.
- He will be in charge of the Ring, Blink, Amazon Key, and Sidewalk teams, succeeding Liz Hamren.
- Siminoff emphasizes the importance of AI transformation, stating it represents a 'once-in-a-generation opportunity'.
- He aims to enhance customer experiences by integrating devices in a connected manner.
- Following his departure, Siminoff sold his new company Honest Day‚Äôs Work to Latch, now known as Door.com.

items.title: We just declared a trade war with the world
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.summary:
- The Trump administration has announced a set of globally applied tariffs that economists criticize as nonsensical and harmful.
- Experts suggest that the tariffs could lead to significant economic downturns, including a 60% chance of recession.
- The tariffs target a broad range of imports, causing immediate stock market losses of $6.6 trillion and increasing costs for consumers.

items.title: Trump‚Äôs TikTok delay is ‚Äòagainst the law‚Äô top Senate Intelligence Democrat says
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- President Trump announced a 75-day delay on TikTok's sale-or-ban deadline, prompting criticism from Senate Intelligence Committee members.
- Senator Mark Warner described the delay as illegal and a sham if the app‚Äôs algorithm remains under Beijing's control.
- House Republicans emphasized the urgency of adhering to U.S. law to prevent Chinese access to American user data.
- Previous bipartisan legislation aimed to address security risks related to TikTok, upheld by the Supreme Court, faced new legal uncertainty due to Trump's actions.
- Democrats in Congress are urging Trump to seek collaboration rather than unilaterally extending deadlines to avoid legal complications for tech companies.

items.title: Car Companies' Responses to Trump's Tariffs: Price Hikes, Layoffs, and Changes in Production
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
* President Trump's 25% tariffs on auto imports disrupt the market, with potential price hikes of $12,000 per vehicle.
* Audi is holding vehicles at US ports; BMW expects a ‚Ç¨1 billion earnings hit; GM is increasing truck production in the US.
* Ford launched a pricing program to counteract consumer panic; Stellantis is laying off 900 workers while pausing production.
* Honda is adjusting production to avoid tariffs; Hyundai is investing $21 billion in the US but warns of potential price increases.
* Toyota is not planning immediate price changes; Volkswagen is adding import fees; Volvo is considering increased US production.

items.title: The best robot vacuums
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Robot vacuums have evolved into intelligent devices, capable of both vacuuming and mopping with limited human intervention.
- Over 70 models have been tested, showcasing diverse options for different household needs, from small apartments to large homes.
- The best overall robot vacuum is the [Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra](https://go.skimresources.com/?id=1025X1701640&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fus.roborock.com%2Fpages%2Froborock-s8-maxv-ultra), priced at $1,799.99, which excels in vacuuming and obstacle detection.
- A budget-friendly option is the [Tapo RV30 Max Plus](https://www.amazon.com/Tapo-Self-Emptying-Max-RV30-Plus/dp/B0DGRJKDKC?tag=theverge02-20), available for around $300, offering solid performance at a lower cost.
- For mopping, the S8 MaxV Ultra features a sonic mopping system that effectively cleans hard floors, with good AI-powered obstacle navigation.

items.title: DOGE staffer ‚ÄòBig Balls‚Äô has access to immigration agency‚Äôs data
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
